result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenan Terrell Knight

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keenan T Knight not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court by video for Keenan T Knight.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Parties requested an adjourned status date. Cases may resolve globally. Court grants request. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Keenan T Knight not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Keenan T Knight.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Parties requests a status conference date.  Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn; both appear by video.  Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Schlachter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Keenan Terrell Knight not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for Franco Mineo the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney McGinn is newly appointed counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 25:

Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight (appears via Zoom video), in custody.  Kelly O'Neill, appearing for Francesco Mineo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appear in person).
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Parties in court to address Atty. Wm. Rakestraw's motion to withdraw as to Case# 21CF04871 and # 21CF05007.

This case adjourned for status on the same date as to Case# 21CF04871 and # 21CF05007 in Branch 25.

Clerk:  jms
Case retabbed to Branch 28 due to  Lower number cases pending.

Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in person.  Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective C.Chlater. On motion of defendant attorney Rakestraw withdrawn from case.  Status hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight not in court, defendant in custody. Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw appear in person.  Francesco Mineo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Parties jointly request an adjournment due to scheduling issues.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Keenan Terrell Knight in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keenan Terrell Knight appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant has lower number caseS pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Sanders. Defense argue motion to dismiss counts 1-9. Court DENY motion to dismiss.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
